citation.title: Connective recovery in social networks after the death of a friend

news.title: Death in a social network encourages online friends to hold on more tightly
news.summary: In the online world as in real life, the shadow of death is unavoidable. But just as in real life, death helps bring the survivors together, according to a study conducted by two researchers, one at UC San Diego and the other at Facebook.

news.title: Facebook: Und was passiert, wenn jemand stirbt?
news.summary: Online wie offline: Daten von Millionen von Facebooknutzern zeigen, wie wir einander nach dem plötzlichen Tod eines Menschen stützen.

news.title: After the death of a friend, healing in a human social network
news.summary: Home Other Sciences Social Sciences April 24, 2017 April 24, 2017 Wounds heal - the cells in a body knit over a cut.

news.title: Death can strengthen social networks for years after the event, Facebook study reveals
news.summary: The death of a friend or loved one brings people together in unexpected ways. But how long do those bonds last? A new study of thousands of friend networks on Facebook finds that even 2 years after someone dies, that person’s friends and…

news.title: Social networks resilient to death(Nature Human Behaviour)
news.summary: Online social networks heal and rebuild following the death of a central member, reports a paper published online this week in Nature Human Behaviour.

news.title: Deaths Really Do Bring Friends Closer Together — At Least On Facebook
news.summary: In the wake of a loved one’s death, there may be a silver lining — at least on Facebook, suggests a new study published Monday in Nature Human Behavior.

news.title: Смерть друга сближает френдов
news.summary: Согласно исследованию ученых из Калифорнийского университета в Сан-Диего, социальные структуры, например соцсети, устойчивы к смерти.

news.title: Ученые выяснили, как соцсети реагируют на смерть участников
news.summary: Смерть одного из членов соцсетей усиливает взаимодействие его «френдов», выяснили ученые.

news.title: Science Of Us When Someone Dies, It Brings Their Extended Online Network Closer for Years
news.summary: The Latest Insights Into Human Behavior, Delivered Daily The Latest Insights Into Human Behavior, Delivered Daily Death can, for obvious reasons, have a profound impact on social networks.

news.title: Facebook can provide safety net for bereaved people
news.summary: April 25 (UPI) -- Researchers at Northeastern University have uncovered insight into how social networks adapt to significant losses, which may help in the grieving process.

news.title: Чужая смерть укрепляет сетевую дружбу
news.summary: Друзья человека после его смерти начинают больше общаться между собой – по крайней мере, в социальной сети.

news.title: The Elegant Way Online Social Networks 'Heal' After a Death
news.summary: Just as life, for many, now takes place both online and in the physical world, so too does death.

news.title: Social Media Can Act as Safety Net for Grief-Stricken | Psych Central News
news.summary: New research suggest social media can helpconnect the bereaved to close friends and that this development and use of social networks mimics biological systems.

news.title: Facebook Can Function as Safety Net for the Bereaved, Study Finds
news.summary: Neuroscientists have long noted that if certain brain cells are destroyed by, say, a stroke, new circuits may be laid in another location to compensate, essentially rewiring the brain.

Смерть друга сближает френдов в сецсетях

Nature Human Behaviour 5月号　Highly-accessed articles
「友人の死後におけるソーシャルネットワーク上のつながりの回復」http://go.nature.com/2sbZgKS

フェイスブック上の15000のネットワークの解析から、インターネット上のソーシャルネットワークは、メンバーの死から立ち直ることが判明し、メンバーの死後に友人間の交流が増加し、何年も安定して続くことがわかった。#NatHumBhav

Цифровое кладбище: как социальные сети реагируют на смерть пользователей

Когда нейрон в мозге погибает, нейронная сеть восстанавливается и компенсирует потерю. Новое исследование показывает, что нечто похожее происходит в социальных сетях после смерти дру

Digital Graveyard: How Social Networks React to User’s Death

When a brain neuron dies, our neural network restores to compensate for the loss. The new research shows that somewhat similar happens in social networks after a user dies.  

Sociologist Willia
